description: Step 1: Bayesian window optimization using Optuna TPE. Runs real forward/reverse sieves across 26 GPUs to find optimal window_size, offset, and skip_range parameters.

window_size.description: Size of the temporal window (number of draws) for PRNG matching.
window_size.effect: Larger windows = more statistical power but slower. 256-1024 typical.

offset.description: Time offset from current draw position.
offset.effect: Non-zero offset may capture periodic PRNG reseeding patterns.

skip_min.description: Minimum skip value for variable skip PRNG patterns.
skip_min.effect: Controls lower bound of skip range search.

skip_max.description: Maximum skip value for variable skip PRNG patterns.
skip_max.effect: Controls upper bound of skip range search. Higher = more flexibility.

forward_threshold.description: Forward sieve match threshold. Higher = stricter filtering.
forward_threshold.effect: Controls false positive rate in forward sieve.
forward_threshold._note: Bounds are INFORMATIONAL ONLY. Runtime bounds defined in distributed_config.json

reverse_threshold.description: Reverse sieve match threshold. Controls historical consistency.
reverse_threshold._note: Bounds are INFORMATIONAL ONLY. Runtime bounds defined in distributed_config.json

window_trials.description: Number of Optuna trials for window parameter optimization.
window_trials.effect: More trials = better exploration but longer runtime. 50-100 typical.

seed_count.description: Number of candidate seeds to test per trial.
seed_count.effect: More seeds = higher recall but O(n) slower. 10M-100M for testing, 1B+ for production.

search_strategy.description: Optuna search strategy for parameter space exploration.
search_strategy.effect: bayesian (TPE) is most sample-efficient. Use random for quick sanity checks.

test_both_modes.description: Test BOTH constant AND variable skip patterns (V2.0 feature).
test_both_modes.effect: Doubles search space but discovers variable skip patterns.
